channel.title: Question about a TOS page
channel.description: Hi, I have a question about my TOS page. Not gonna lie, I stole the base of it from mopar but I completely revised it. Anyway I need to know how to make it so it stores it as a cookie and it doesn't ever display the page again UNLESS you delete your cookies. Does anyone know how to do this?

item.title: Question about a TOS page
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:6, topic:289063”][quote author=Server-Unknown.Net link=topic=382152.msg2871324#msg2871324 date=1247780605]

-snip-

Why not just insert it into your footer or header include page?
[/quote]
It depends on the website/forum framework, but sure, you can do that. (Header)[/quote]
That’s stupid to do though, unless you use output buffering.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about a TOS page
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

Google PHP Cookies and then learn how to code it your self.
http://www.w3schools.com/PHP/php_cookies.asp

Read full topic

item.title: Question about a TOS page
item.dc:creator: @_Jake2 `Jake
item.description:
@_Jake2 wrote:

Sorry guys I guess you could call me a noob when it comes to this kind of stuff in websites. Where exactly do I put that code? I tried putting it in places in the tos.php and also in one place near the end in the global.php but neither one worked. Can you please explain further?
Thanks,

`Jake

Read full topic

item.title: Question about a TOS page
item.dc:creator: @Server-Unknown.Net Server-Unknown.Net
item.description:
@Server-Unknown.Net wrote:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:1, topic:289086”]In a file that’s included in every page. include(‘global.php’); or something
[php]
if (empty($_COOKIE[‘sitename_tos’])) {
header(‘Location: http://site.com/tos.php’);
}
[/php]

tos.php
[php]
// your tos page with something that sets the cookie if you accept at the end.
[/php][/quote]

Why not just insert it into your footer or header include page?

Read full topic

item.title: Question about a TOS page
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

If you didn’t have the real TOS page from here, http://www.moparisthebest.com/agreement.phps

If you read the code from the page you would know how to use it, otherwise google cookies…

Read full topic
